DataElement.preferredName: Gastrointestinal Obstruction or Hemorrhage Symptoms with Possible Eligibility for Intervention or Procedure Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator to signify whether or not a person has clinical symptoms of gastrointestinal obstruction or bleeding and consideration for immediate surgery or immediate neoadjuvent chemoradiation

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Gastrointestinal Obstruction or Hemorrhage Symptoms with Possible Eligibility for Intervention or Procedure
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to the stomach and intestines._Blockage of a passageway._Bleeding or escape of blood from a vessel._An indication that a person has a condition or disease.  Some examples of symptoms are headache, fever, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and pain._Capable of happening or occurring._Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services._An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population.  This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmnetal acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to the stomach and intestines. :Blockage of a passageway.:Bleeding or escape of blood from a vessel.:An indication that a person has a condition or disease.  Some examples of symptoms are headache, fever, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and pain.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to the stomach and intestines.
Blockage of the normal flow of the contents of an anatomical passageway.
The flow of blood from a ruptured blood vessel.
Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.

Property.preferredName: Possible Eligibility Determination Intervention or Procedure
Property.preferredDefinition: Capable of happening or occurring.:Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.:An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population.  This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmnetal acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.

Concepts.definition: The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.

ConceptualDomain.preferredName: Chronic or Associated Diseases and Exposures
ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: chronic diseases, as well as diseases and exposures associated with cancer.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.
